poem:
**Soho Fabergé**

In a Soho pub, a hand slipped  
like a shy fish into a handbag  
and came up glittering,  
astonished at its own catch—  
a Fabergé egg, a watch,  
two million pounds of hush.

The thief in grey sweats  
must have blinked at the tiny, jeweled planet  
and wondered what time it was  
inside.
